definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline

sentences.english: A serious low for Beckham was at the 1998 World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆的最低谷是在1998年的世界杯。

sentences.english: When feeling is in lowermost cereal, be to want to abandon or continue hard?
sentences.chinese: 当感情处于最低谷时，是要放弃还是继续努力？

sentences.english: We have spent together, the lowest point of life.
sentences.chinese: 我们在一起度过了人生的最低谷。

sentences.english: July, 2011 will be low watermark for year-over-year price trends in housing.
sentences.chinese: 2011年7月将是住房价格同比趋势最低谷的时期。

sentences.english: The diplomacy inside right now Yang Zhi is tired, cereal of sink life lowest.
sentences.chinese: 此时的杨志内外交困，陷于人生最低谷。

definition: valley/trough (as opposed to peaks)/fig. low point/lowest ebb/nadir of one's fortunes
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
lit. like the sun at noon (idiom)/fig. to be at the peak of one's power, career etc
summit/apex/pinnacle (of one's career etc)/peak (of a civilization etc)
rivers pour away by the day (idiom); going from bad to worse/deteriorating day by day
lit. to drop a thousand zhang in one fall (idiom)/fig. (of business, popularity etc) to suffer a sudden, devastating decline/to take a dive
tossed about by the wind and rain (idiom)/(of a situation) unstable
